page.title: 04THE WALKER IN ARUNDEL PARK
page.content: Arundel Park, a large area of enclosed downland offers beautiful surroundings for the walker. Part of the main valley contains Swanbourne Lake which is served by many springs of clear water. In parts swampy edges provide the environment for water plants and many birds frequent the lake, some being escapees from the Wildfowl Reserve nearby. A path encircles the lake, sometimes rising above the level of the lake. Trees grow close to the water or give way to show the grassy slopes of the Downland, where sheep graze. Woods cover the western slopes, predominantly beeches which give in Autumn carpets of yellow and red leaves. Plantations of mixed trees and one or two groups of pines add charac- ter to the landscape and extensive views are revealed of the surrounding countryside as far as the sea.
